The '''marshes in the south''' were likely a collection of smaller marshes or one marsh that lay along the southern border of the [[Shire]] in the [[Southfarthing]].<ref name="FRHobbits">{{FR|Hobbits}}</ref>

== Geography ==
The marshes in the south were likely on or near the [[Baranduin|River Brandywine]]. It is unknown if the marshes in the south consisted of multiple marshes or one singular marsh. Regardless, however, they were also roughly fifty leagues (150  miles) south of the [[North Moors|northern moors]].<ref name="FRHobbits">{{FR|Hobbits}}</ref> It is possible that the marshes in the south were actually just the [[Overbourn Marshes]],<ref>{{HM|AME}}, p. 70</ref> but this is unknown.

== History ==
In the year {{TA|1601}} the [[Hobbits]] set out to cross the Brandywine River led by the brothers [[Marcho]] and [[Blanco]] to live in their new home of the shire. The hobbits had previously agreed with King [[Argeleb II]] on the borders of the shire, with the southern border being the marshes in the south.<ref name="FRHobbits">{{FR|Hobbits}}</ref>
